snippet: The Security Council on Thursday endorsed West African political efforts to end unrest in Mali but stopped short of backing military intervention.
abstract: United Nations Security Council threatens sanctions against Islamist fighters in northern Mali and condemns the destruction of sacred tombs in Timbuktu, but it does not authorize an intervention force.
lead_paragraph: The Security Council on Thursday endorsed West African political efforts to end unrest in Mali but stopped short of backing military intervention.

headline.main: Security Council Puts Off Mali Force
headline.print_headline: Security Council Puts Off Mali Force

keywords.value: Economic Community of West African States (Ecowas)
keywords.name: organizations
